newsitem.title: CHINA: China urged to reform interest rate system.
newsitem.headline: China urged to reform interest rate system.

text.p: China should adopt a flexible market-driven interest rate mechanism to replace the current system in which the government sets rates, an official of a government-backed research body has been quoted as saying.

"It is natural to let interest rates to rise and fall, just like prices of commodities," the China Business Times quoted Wang Guoxiang, vice director of the China Urban Financial Institute, as saying.
The current interest rate system had led to excessive speculation over whether the central bank would cut interest rates, he said.
Central bank officials have said they consider present interest rate levels appropriate after two rate cuts last May and August.

Wang said the current rate system had created official corruption in the banking sector and forced some people and firms to set unofficial interest rates in their borrowing and lending, but he gave no details.
Bank officials have said China's fledgling interbank market is the basis for the emergence of a new banking ststem in which the market -- not the government -- sets interest rates.
